chargeHist.descr: Battery or Threat to Judge, Prosecutor, or Law Enforcement Officer

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 10:45 am.

3:20 PM Defendant Devon Anthony Keller in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Devon Anthony Keller.  Attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Reetz requests another plea/sentencing date.  Bond remains in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

4:13 PM Defendant Devon Anthony Keller in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Devon Anthony Keller.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Reetz indicates defendant is accepting states offer, requests plea/sentencing date. Bond remains in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 04:15 pm.

11:53 AM Defendant Devon Anthony Keller not in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Devon Anthony Keller.  Prosecuting attorney Aleksandra Hodowany in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Reetz has no explanation for non appearance of defendant.  State requests statewide warrant.  Atty Reetz requests stay warrant until tomorrow.  Court grants request, issues statewide warrant, stays warrant until 10/6/22 at noon.
Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:25 PM  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon Anthony Keller in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Devon Anthony Keller.   Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Reetz indicates matter is not resolved yet, requests another status in 60-90 days.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on July 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

1:30 PM   Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devon Anthony Keller in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Devon Anthony Keller.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Reetz requests more time to discuss State's offer with defendant before proceeding.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

3:12 PM  Defendant Devon Anthony Keller in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Devon Anthony Keller.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Reetz requests a status in early June.  State has not objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.
Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.

9:37 AM  Defendant Devon Anthony Keller in court.  Attorney Brett E Reetz in court for Devon Anthony Keller.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, indicate defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing today.
Status conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on April 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 002696,
Payable Number: 100116,
Amount: $20.00
Subpoena Witness Data Sheet
by Taylor Baker.
Defendant was fingerprinted 3/04/22.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:08 AM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Devon Anthony Keller appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on how he wishes to proceed regarding legal representation.  Defendant requests time to try and retain Atty Brett Reetz on his own.  Court adjourns matter today.  Defendant requests bond modification, requests a lower cash bond or cash bond be converted to a signature bond.  State opposes request to bond modification, gives argument.  Court makes statement, denies request for bond modification.  Bond remains in effect as previously set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Maintain absolute sobriety. No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores or any establishment whose primary purpose is the sale and/or consumption of alcohol except for employment purposes. Not to possess or consume any alcohol. Do not operate a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license and subject to any conditions or restrictions on that license. No contact direct or indirect with Officers Brandon Shew or Trevor Haack and their residences except in an official capacity.

11:48 AM Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Devon Anthony Keller appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Defendant indicates he does not qualify for SPD representation.  Court explains options to defendant regarding legal representation.  Court will send petition for appointment of counsel form down to the jail with defendants bond.  Defendant to fill out form, if that's the route he wishes to go and file form with the court before his next hearing.  Court questions defendant on current address/employment.  Bond set.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Uniform traffic citations tracking file
